intro: Aechmea magdalenae, commonly known as the Magdalena bromeliad, is a striking plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family, characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central water-holding cup. The plant features vibrant, long-lasting inflorescences that range in color from red to orange, often surrounded by showy bracts. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered with a dense layer of trichomes, which help in water retention and protection from intense sunlight. Aechmea magdalenae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to indoor environments.
